casebody.data:
CINCINNATI MILACRON, LTD., Appellant, v. M/V AMERICAN LEGEND, her engines, boilers, etc., and United States Lines, Inc., Appellees. No. 85-1183. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Argued Oct. 7, 1986. Decided Nov. 6, 1986. James D. Skeen (David W. Skeen, Constable, Alexander, Daneker & Skeen, on brief), for appellant. John H. West, III (Roann Nichols, Ober, Kaler, Grimes & Shriver, on brief), for appellees.

Before WINTER, RUSSELL, WIDENER, HALL, PHILLIPS, SPROUSE, ERVIN, CHAPMAN, WILKINSON and WILKINS, Circuit Judges, sitting en banc.

PER CURIAM:

On rehearing of this appeal en banc, the judgment of the district court is affirmed for reasons stated in the dissent to the superseded panel decision. See Cincinnati Milacron, Ltd. v. M/V American Legend, 784 F.2d 1161, 1166 (4th Cir.1986) (dissenting opinion).

Chief Judge Winter and Judge Ervin dissent and would reverse for reasons stated in the superseded opinion for the panel majority. See id. at 1162.

AFFIRMED.
